title: Children
content:
From Flaose's KeenFAQ; section 2.3.4:

[quote]Quote:[hr]Children: Other children captured by Boobus Tubers' Dream Machine.
They just sit and wave to our hero as he passes by.[hr][/quote]

There are children in Keen Dreams? Where are they seen? Do I have the wrong version? Someone please tell me!

title: Re: Children
content: You see them while walking on the map? Those little things that wave at you.

title: Re: Children
content:
As far as I know they are just story elements, not seen in any version.

I think those things that wave at you are some kind of plants! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Children
content:
That's what I thought; they look like waving trees.
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Cute bunny!

title: Re: Children
content:
You are what you eat: The trees were kids who had nothing to eat but veggies...Tough Guys Wear Pink!!!

title: Re: Children
content:
I always thought those were living trees. After carefully reading KDreams story text (or help text was it?) I decided that they were children hiding on trees from the plant baddies, that wave at their hero, Commander Keen.------------------

content:
Yeah, and pigs can fly...

IMO: Those "trees" are trees with children hiding in its leaves (the green things that cover the top of a tree, find better word plz). And those life-up items are Keen dolls. BTW, have you considered their size in comparison to that of Keen himslef?------------------

title: Re: Children
content:
I was in fact being sarcastic, but I still don't believe your argument about kids hiding in trees, it sounds a little, well, made up to me.

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/tree.png[/img]

I mean look at these guys, the waving arms are brown, the smile and eyes are in the tree top itself [Red irises] They look in fact, like trees with eyes and smiles, waving.
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Cute bunny!

title: Re: Children
content:
Well, if the veggies are alive, the trees most likely are, too.-Genius314

title: Re: Children
content:
But why trees would be friendly if veggies are not?
(If trees are friendly, then grapes would be friendly too.)

Anyway, I didn't like much this episode due to the fact the creators give kids a subliminal message "don't eat veggetables, avoid them". Puaj.------------------
SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

title: Re: Children
content:
Ah, but the trees in Keen 4, though not exactly nice, are rather sleepy and harmless. I don't see why grapes would have to be friendly, trees are much older and less mobile than vegetables, they're about the only thing that can't move, I'd think this and thier advanced age would lead them to take a more kindly disposition towards everyone, you always know where a tree is, and can take an axe to meet it if mad.
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Cute bunny!

title: Re: Children
content:
But even though the trees can't get up and walk around, they (at least the ones in Keen Dreams) can move their limbs, so if one did decide it didn't like you, it could give you a pretty big -thwack- if you got too close to it...[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] "A man is the less likely to become great the more he is dominated by reason: few can achieve greatness - and none in art - if they are not dominated by illusion."
--Mr. Doctor

title: Re: Children
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]But even though the trees can't get up and walk around, they (at least the ones in Keen Dreams) can move their limbs, so if one did decide it didn't like you, it could give you a pretty big -thwack- if you got too close to it...[hr][/quote]

But they're still rooted, which means you just have to step back and wait, you can do anything you want, erect screens to shade them out, fire flaming arrows, undermine their dirt, anything. So it pays to be nice.
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Cute bunny!

title: Re: Children
content:
Yeah...those children are looking more and more like friendly trees...--------------------
